result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Balletta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Participate in DV reviews.

records.addlTxt: from Br 4  to Def   re; As of 2-1-16 there will no longer be Probation Reviews - your Hrg of 2-16-16 has been canceled
Probation Status Report filed.
Probation review hearing at 02-16-2016 04:00 pm

4:27 PM   - Def in court.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
He did well in groups. I am order pull order for restraunts for businesses. 
TALK ABOUT IS WRITING ASSIGNMENT AT FEB REVIEW  Probation review hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
AJC done for jail ordered @ Probation Review on 8-25-15

4:21 pm - Def in court. 
Def hasn't completed any more community service.  I have made arrangements to complete some.  I have a severe knee injury and can't stand for long periods of time.  
CT:  You have been unemployed for 12 weeks.  You should have done 120 hours of community service. 
Def:  She was concerned about the community service but she was impressed with other things that I have done.  I know that I have to complete community service. 
CT:  I feel some incarcerate is necessary.   
Def has been participating in AODA counseling.  Completed DV groups. He did quite well in the program.  
CT:  Report to Jail on 8/28/15 at 6pm ; Release 8/30/15 @ 6pm
Def to work thru decision points of the criminal complaint - put it in writing. 
REV:  12/8/15 @ 4pm (SLH)

4:12 pm - Def in court.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Completed AODA and started classes.  Employed on part-time basis.  Working on community service.  
Rev: 8/25/15 @ 4pm (SLH)
Probation review hearing on June 16, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

4:02 PM - Def in court.  Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Crt: disappointed to see the OWI
Def: I talked to Dick Brewer and was told I could see him when he gets back
Crt: if you were a  .202, you minimized some of the usage - that is a high level and people who are casual drinkers can't get to that level. Since you aren't working this is a good time to get your CS hours done. If not working I want 10 hrs/wk.  Probation review hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Probation review hearing on May 12, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

4:27 PM  - Def in court.  Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
First appearance for review. PO is Heidi Altag (?). Just got approval for Badgercare and assume my AODA assmt will be covered after that. I have been sober since this case. I have had 5 mos JSS daily testing. PO said if Badgercare wouldn't cover it she knew a few places that might be able to help me. In DOMAB classes. 10 hrs com service done so far but I injured my knee and I had x rays and was told to stay off it for a while and I might need replacement surgery but I want to take a bunch of this off.
Mark: he's been doing fairly well and participates.  Probation review hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
assigned PO Heidi Ulteig

1:43 PM - Def in court w/Atty Thomas Y. Huh.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ct. 3 - Battery - Guilty
Ct. 4 - Crim trespass - Guilty
remaining charges dismissed and read in
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs in the last 24 hrs  
Plea is F, V made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
Minser: serious offense. Both were drinking but she left as she saw that things were turning bad. He went after her while she was sleeping. He armed himself w/ a bat. He got physical w/ her. Criminal history
Huh: asking for lower amt of probation. He has 2 days credit. He has custody of his son and he raised that issue w/ JSS and there has to be an official accommodation for visits and the events that happen w/ his son and provide transportation. 
Def: sorry about the events that took place. I can't take it back but regret what happened.
SENTENCE:
Sentence withheld - 18 mos probation on each count concurrent w/ conditions concurrent.
Cond:  Ct. 3 - def to serve  30  days CJ to be served on EM thru JSS w/ credit for 2 days.  Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations;  Do not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from a licensed physician. Random testing;  No contact with H Jensen except as approved by the PO; Def to undergo Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations; participate in DV reviews.75 hrs com service during period of probation. Pay DOC fees & CC

Review hearing: 3/3 @ 4
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Thomas Huh
Status conference on October 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
